get.description:
This resource specifies the media control capabilities of a device.
Retrieves the current media control settings.
Current state is "play" therefore play will not be in response as a transitions.
The transitions from "play" are the following:
- stop
- pause
- fastforward (trick modes) change, using uri templates:
  https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570
  where the expanded url will be:
  mediaControlResURI?media_speed=2.5
  where the "allowed_values" gives the list of allowed values for the substitution
- rewind (trick modes) change, using uri templates:
  https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570
  where the expanded url will be:
  mediaControlResURI?media_speed=-0.5
  where the "allowed_values" gives the list of allowed values for the substitution
- stepforward (trick modes) change, using uri templates:
  https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570
  where the expanded url will be:
  mediaControlResURI?media_location=2.5
  where the "range" gives the range of allowed values and "range_step" give step increment for the substitution
- stepbackward (trick modes) change, using uri templates:
  https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570
  where the expanded url will be:
  mediaControlResURI?media_location=-0.5
  where the "range" gives the range of allowed values and "range_step" give step increment for the substitution
- seek (location change), using uri templates:
  https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570
  where the expanded url will be:
  mediaControlResURI?media_location=53
  where the "range" gives the range of allowed values for the substitution

post.description: Sets the current media control values

anyOf.description: This is the target URI, it can be specified as a Relative Reference or fully-qualified URI.
Reference time for the absolute time in ISO 8601 datetime format (e.g: 'Date Only: 2018-06-23', 'Date and Time: 2018-06-23T20:22:59', 'Date, Time, and Timezone'PST': 2018-06-23T20:22:59-08:00')
Supports Rate Control for float values and Frame By Frame for integer values for both positive and negative values.
